FuncDef:
The control-tunnel authentication keychain command configures keychain authentication for a control channel.
The undo control-tunnel authentication keychain command restores the default configuration.
By default, no keychain authentication is configured for a control channel.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a keychain name, which is configured using the keychain command.
The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-insensitive characters. The string does not contain question marks or spaces. The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed in double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In the virtual access system, an AP and master establish a control channel to exchange control information. To improve control channel security, run the control-tunnel authentication keychain command on a master to configure keychain authentication for the control channel. After the AP and master establish a NETCONF channel, the master delivers the command configuration to the AP.
Prerequisites
A node has been configured as a master using the role master command.A keychain has been created using the keychain command.

Configuration Impact
After the control-tunnel authentication keychain command is run, the master uses a specified keychain to authenticate the AP. If the authentication fails, a control channel cannot be established.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
When you directly log in to an AP:
If the AP has established a NETCONF channel to a master, the control-tunnel authentication keychain command cannot be run.If the AP has not established a NETCONF channel to a master, the control-tunnel authentication keychain command can be run.
This command supports the reference of an undefined keychain. However, if the number of keychains that has been defined on a device reaches the upper limit, this command does not support the reference of an undefined keychain.
